common_issues.title: Pieces OS and application performance issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS not running after multiple attempts and reinstallation on Windows.  Additionally, the desktop application is slow, laggy, and unresponsive, especially after the latest update.  LLMs are also not providing complete or correct code. Troubleshooting may include checking system compatibility, reinstalling, or reverting to a previous version.

common_issues.title: Copilot struggles to access and utilize workstream activities
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot failing to locate or interact correctly with workstream activities, especially when generating daily work reports or updating past tasks.  Issues include time range selection being ignored and inability to access multiple activities simultaneously.  While single activity access via the 'start copilot chat' button may function, the core problem persists across macOS and potentially other platforms. Further investigation into data indexing and retrieval within workstreams is needed.

related_issues.title: Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
related_issues.text:
Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Last week, I used the copilot for creating report of the day's work logs.
It worked properly but I doesn't work since yesterday(I don't know the issue starts from yesterday but I detected it on yesterday)

Copliot can't find the activities in workstream and It doesn't care about time range selection.

It works when using 'start copilot chat' button in specific activity, but can't use with multiple activities.

I hope to use it for creating daily work report everyday.

- requested today's daily work report

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues and Failure to Launch
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance and unresponsiveness in the Pieces desktop app and VS Code extension, especially after updates or sending multiple messages.  Some users experience application crashes or complete failure to launch. Issues appear on Windows OS across versions 10.0.1 and 12.0.0.  Troubleshooting steps like hard reset haven't resolved the problems. An error related to the Gemini-pro model is also frequently reported.

related_issues.title: UI in Pieces OS for VS Code is extremely slow after sending several messages
related_issues.text:
UI in Pieces OS for VS Code is extremely slow after sending several messages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After sending several messages to Pieces Copilot in the extension for VS Code, there is a significant performance drop to the program which leads to the app eventually becoming extremely slow and difficult to use when pressing buttons, using keyboard input, and the speed of which a LLM responds. CPU usage and RAM usage also spikes when this occurs.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows: Crashes, slow performance, and failure to launch
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Windows report Pieces desktop app and OS issues.  Crashes occur when moving the app window or scrolling.  Performance is slow and unresponsive, especially in Copilot chat.  Pieces OS fails to launch even after reinstallation.  Issues span different Pieces versions (10.0.1, 12.0.0). Further investigation needed to pinpoint root cause and solutions across affected versions.

common_issues.title: Authentication and Startup Issues in Pieces OS 12.0.0
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty authenticating or starting Pieces OS 12.0.0 on Windows and macOS.  Authentication errors include failure to receive verification codes and generic error messages during the authentication flow.  Startup issues involve the application failing to launch or requiring login after extended offline periods.  Potential solutions include checking firewall settings, trying different browsers, reinstalling the application, and verifying network connectivity.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.text:
Pieces OS is not running even after several attempts and reinstallation
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eef39ab8-c92c-46d6-bb74-233b3145acd9)

### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i have tried several times to start the Pieces OS but it is not running even after several attempts and reinstallation
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the 'Pieces OS and application performance issues' as it has the highest frequency and impacts Windows users significantly. Investigate system compatibility, reinstallation processes, and potential bugs introduced in the latest update.

Address the 'Copilot struggles to access and utilize workstream activities' issue affecting macOS users. Focus on improving data indexing and retrieval within workstreams, ensuring Copilot correctly interacts with multiple activities and respects time range selections.

Investigate and resolve the authentication and startup issues, particularly for Pieces OS 12.0.0 on Windows and macOS.  Test the authentication flow, verification code delivery, and address any generic error messages.  Ensure the application launches reliably after extended offline periods.
Address the high-activity tickets, starting with #716 (LLM code generation issues) and #315 (slow/laggy desktop application).  These tickets likely represent broader user pain points.
Improve error messaging and logging, especially for authentication issues and application crashes.  More specific error codes and log details will help in faster diagnosis and resolution.
Gather more data on user environments (OS versions, hardware specs) to identify patterns and potential platform-specific issues.
Consider adding troubleshooting steps to the documentation or FAQs for common issues like application crashes, slow performance, and authentication problems.
